strongest_moat.name: Counter-Positioning
strongest_moat.rationale: Business model structurally forces all competitors (static demo platforms, scheduling tools, enterprise sandbox platforms, human SDR services) into innovator's dilemmas requiring self-harm to compete. This is demonstrable TODAY in the business model structure.

counter_positioning.rationale: Forces incumbents to choose between cannibalizing existing revenue or ceding AI-live demo category. Static demo platforms cannot offer unlimited live AI without destroying per-seat revenue. Scheduling platforms cannot add AI delivery without competing with customers. Enterprise sandbox platforms cannot match instant AI pricing without destroying economics.

speed.rationale: AI voice agent stack enables faster iteration than competitors building sandbox/video platforms. <5 minute response time means velocity is core value prop. No technical debt yet - can pivot quickly. Competitors constrained by legacy approaches and enterprise customer requirements.

scale_economies.rationale: AI infrastructure costs amortize at scale - marginal cost per demo approaches zero. Human SDRs have constant $80K+/year cost. More demos = better AI training without proportional cost increase. Integration development and voice model training are fixed costs benefiting all customers.

cornered_resources.rationale: Every AI demo generates proprietary conversational data competitors cannot replicate. Custom-trained voice agents per industry/product become proprietary. Deep CRM integration data on qualification signals unique to 10Demo. Design partner exclusivity provides enterprise customer data early.

switching_costs.rationale: Moderate lock-in through CRM integration depth, AI training investment, and workflow integration. However, early-stage means low current switching costs. Competitors can copy integrations. Strengthening requires building proprietary Demo Intelligence dashboard and multi-year contracts.

network_effects.rationale: Data network effects exist (more demos → better AI → more customers) but indirect only. Industry template effects possible (more FinTech customers → better FinTech AI). Integration network effects standard for SaaS. NOT direct user-to-user, marketplace, or collaboration platform.

process_power.rationale: AI training workflows and compliance certifications could create barriers. Enterprise customers (FinTech, Healthcare) require strict compliance. However, still early-stage with no proprietary processes built yet. Takes 3-5 years to develop. Competitors have 10+ year head start.

brand.rationale: New category with no established brand leader. Trust concerns about AI hallucinations mean trust must be earned slowly. Crowded market with well-funded competitors. Utility category where buyers care about performance not prestige. Brand takes 5-10 years to build - not realistic short-term moat.

key_strengths: Counter-positioning creates innovator's dilemma for all competitors
5 strong moats (7-10 scores) provide redundant defensibility
Speed, scale economies, and data moats highly buildable within 6-18 months
Moats reinforce each other (speed → data → scale → switching costs)
key_risks: Brand takes 5-10 years - not realistic short-term moat
Network effects weak without direct user-to-user value
Process power requires 3-5 years and enterprise focus
summary.recommendation: PROCEED with high confidence. 10Demo has defensibility on par with top 10% of B2B SaaS ventures at validation stage. Focus execution on high-priority moats: counter-positioning (maintain), speed (build immediately), scale economies (build immediately), cornered resources (build immediately).
